Author: zack#6467
Content: So there are different levels of trustedness. I wonder if it is really continuous, or if there are discrete levels of trust.

Author: zack#6467
Content: I wonder if the math works the same for each flavor of trustedness

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe there is a trust quanta, but likely it is effectively continuous as there is really a very large variety of trustedness

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and likely nearly impossible to fully analyze

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if reputations can be abstracted away, maybe it can be

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so when analyzing a specific usage, if it doesnt increase the level of trust required, then even if it isnt trustless, it didnt increase the trust required and did no harm

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is why gateways CC using oracles CC doesnt increase the trustedness

Author: zack#6467
Content: seals vs locks is a pretty solid difference possible for doors in physical space, it is interesting how much your example is like a seal instead of a lock. it makes me feel like there is only a handful of levels of trustedness.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the big trust is in the 7of 13 multisig signers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: likely most things would be in similar levels

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with the entire universe potentially headed to blockchain, there is likely some edge case at every level of trustedness. seems very hard to disprove or even come up with a non-qualitative measure

Author: zack#6467
Content:
a single merkel root should be enough to fully specify every key press of the game.
If the server publishes the merkel root, and all the players can verify that they received the same merkel root, then they can know the game executed correctly. 
Then lots of merkel proofs can be used to check that any moment of the game was calculated correctly.
